title: 2024.08.20 LogCOMET B. spiz CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Make flow cytometry measurement of In prep - 2024.08.20 LogCOMET_SamplePrep
  • Based on the last two logcomet experiments, flow is non-proportional with higher events proportionally at higher DF
    • This was true for both experiments (10 uL/min and 30 uL/min)
    • Does it depend on vortexing? Joy and Alshae' have more proportional results and both use the big vortex. But I prep all the samples in the BSC with the small vortex which means they're receiving proportional samples.
    • Does it depend on dilution ratio? No, everyone doing the same
    • Does it depend on plasticware? Will measure in flow tube and eppendorf
      • 1 indicates in polystyrene tube, 2 indicates in polypropylene tube, 3 indicates in eppendorf
    • Does it depend on incubation time? Looking at the unstained sample added to flow tubes immediately after dilution (1_1:3) vs those that were incubated with the Hoechst samples (1_4:5) vs those in the eppendorf (3_1)

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex 
    3. Run Consumable - 1:9 PBS Dilution to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions
    1. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Trigger -H = 1e4, -W
      NUV450 25  
      R660 200  
      V450 200 *Just for interest
      B525 200 *Just for interest
      Y675 200 *Just for interest
  4. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS: Dilute 5 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 45 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
  5. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (6 samples +1)*987 uL buffer = 6.909 mL PBS
    2. 14 uL HWS
  6. Prepare samples
    1. All these dilutions were vortexed in the BSC with small vortex 
    2. Unstained: 990 uL PBS + 10 uL Cell sample (SA) 
    3. Probe: 500 uL staining buffer
    4. Samples: 990 uL staining buffer + 10 uL cells
    5. Move to incubator for 30 min
      1. Start time - 11:51 am
      2. End time - 12:36 pm
      3. Stored in BSC until analysis 
  7. For each sample tube: 
    1. Run order: PBS, Unst (3x from fresh tube), Unst (2x from incubated tube), ProbeOnly, samples
    2. Vortex the tube using big vortex (not BSC)
    3. Transfer 500 uL to flow tube 
    4. Run on cytometer for 2 min at 30 uL/min
    5. Repeat if second observation 
  8. What if it's the amount of salt (PBS) that is the issue?
    1. Make A_4 from 900 uL Water + 90 uL PBS + 10 uL stock cells
    2. Make A_5 from 990 uL PBS + 10 uL stock cells
    3. Notice that neither of these are observational reps of "A", closer to sample reps  
  9.  Cleanup
    1. **Note: 30 min with fresh 10% Consumable - Bleach for all surfaces**
    2. Run 10 min bleach and rinse with 10 min water
    3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
    4. Shutdown
    5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
    6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

  • Running three replicates of the unstained sample (added to flow tube immediately after dilution). Sample measured concentration goes down every replicate, is it sticking to the flow tube?
  • Lower count on observational reps is consistent across all tubes
  • Tube type doesn't seem to matter
  • Need to check math to find out if vortexing helped with proportionality
  • Still not seeing all the fluorescent subpopulations as before. Something to do with adding CellTracker?

title: 2024.08.20 LogCOMET_SamplePrep
body:
Purpose:

  • Prepare MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Project - LogCOMET dilutions

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
TSA B. spizizinii Rep C 1-24 MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

 

Preparing Dilutions:

  1. Obtain filtered Consumable - 1:9 PBS Dilution from Person - Alshae' Logan that has passed conductivity check
  2. See GUI for generating dilutions
  3. For each tube
    1. Pipette the indicated media volume
    2. Invert the tightly closed cell stock x2 to mix
    3. Pipetted the indicated cell volume
    4. Record time

title: 2024.08.15 CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
body:
Purpose:

  • Calibrate Instrument - CytoFLEX volume measurements

 

Protocol:

  1. Start up the instrument
  2. System startup wizard
  3. Prepare 1 mL Consumable - SterileWater in flow tube
  4. Record mass of tube "before" 
    1. 4.4545 g
  5. Run volume calibration wizard
  6. Record mass of tube "after"
    1. 4.2737 g
  7. Determine whether calibration has passed

Observations:

title: 2024.08.12 E.coli RM on CytoFLEX
body:
Purpose:

  • Practice for characterizing E.coli material for RM, using old materials

 

Sample starting material(s): 

 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
RCP Consumable - RainbowBeads_AN04   Person - Kirsten Parratt
Duke Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464    
Matrix MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_QuickMeltMatrix_PS42281   Person - Sandra Da Silva
VC Consumable - ViaComp_SSB07A_211104 Previously estimated 6e4 particle/drop, adding to 100 uL gives ~e5 particle/mL Person - Kirsten Parratt
Fixed TBS_NIST_Fixed

This material estimated at 2.33e8 cell/mL in: Ready for export - 2024.07.03 CytoFLEX GC+MDiS

 Person - Sandra Da Silva
CBP Consumable - CBPBeads_2707082   Person - Kirsten Parratt
Test

MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli120hr_PS49921;

MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBEcoli120hr_PS48791

   Person - Sandra Da Silva

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
    1. Water tube for volume calibration
    2. QC beads
    3. RCP
    4. Duke beads
    5. CBP
    6. ViaComp 
    7. Fixed cells
    8. Centrifuge tubes: Consumable - MicrocentrifugeTube_Avantor_10025-724
    9. Flow tubes: Consumable - FlowTube_FalconPolystyrene_352054
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up (9:54 am)
    2. Run a volume calibration experiment
      1. Link: In prep - 2024.08.12 CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
    3. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex (new bottle, same lot)
    4. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 1  
      VSSC 20 4000 - H, Width
      NUV450 25  
      B525 50  
      Y585 50  
    5. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead scatter gate 
  4. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Dilute 10 uL Consumable - Hoechst in 90 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Will have four control types (pbs, matrix, viacomp, fixed) + 2 types of sample (M9, TSB) * 3 sample replicates = 10 tubes
    3. Make 11 mL of PBS with 2*11 uL HWS (22 uL HWS)
  5. Weigh blank tubes to prepare
  6. Prepare the stock of Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464
    1. (~ 8.43e8 bead/mL from Ready for export - 2024.07.30 BSA + Bead Sample Prep)
    2. Vortex 30 sec
    3. Add 2 drops to tube (Time: 11:07 am)
    4. Dilute 10 uL beads into 990 uL PBS (~8.43 e6 bead/mL)
    5. Dilute 118.6 uL into 881.3 uL PBS (~1e6 bead/mL)
    6. Add 200 uL to a flow tube
    7. Acquire 3 min at 10 uL/min
    8. Repeat observation
  7. Rehydrate lyophilized materials
    1. Tube Starting Tube Mass (1) Rehydrated mass (2) Notes
      Matrix 1.9095 2.9100  
      M9 1.8567 2.8533  
      TSB 1.8554 2.8532  
    1. Time: 11:17 am
  8. Aliquot into tubes such that total is 1 mL
    1. Weigh empty tubes
    2. Add buffer to each tube
    3. Weigh
    4. Add cells to each tube ( am)
    5. Weigh
    6. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample (uL) Target Sample mass (3) Buffer (uL) Target Staining Buffer Mass (2)
      Duke Diluted 1.1010 10 2.1028 990 - PBS 2.0928
      Duke Run Sample 1.0853 118.6 2.0951 881.3 - PBS 1.9715
      PBS -- 0 -- 1000 PBS --
      Unstained M9 1.0934 100 2.0932 900 - PBS 1.9941
      Unstained TSB 1.0634 100 2.0641 900 - PBS 1.9629
      Matrix 1.0856 100 2.0816 900 - Stain 1.9808
      ViaComp -- 2 drops -- 200 - Stain --
      Fixed 1.0967 50 2.0895 950 - Stain 2.0412
  9. Incubate tubes, target 30 min
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
    2. Start time:  11:32 am
    3. End time: 12:04 pm
  10. Prepare unstained/matrix sample flow tubes
    1. Weigh empty tubes
    2. Add 400 uL PBS to each tube
    3. Weigh
    4. Add 50 uL CBP to each tube after vortexing
    5. Weigh 
    6. Add 50 uL cells to each tube (5e5 - 1e6 cell/mL)
    7. Weigh
    8. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (4) PBS Mass (2) CBP Mass (3) Notes
      PBS  3.5008 3.9973 3.8951 3.9474  
      Unstained M9 3.4761 3.9790 3.8774 3.9309  
      Unstained TSB 3.4888 3.9914 3.8905 3.9412  
      Matrix 3.4832 3.9801 3.8844 3.9310  
      Fixed 3.4745 3.9868 3.8863 3.9336  
  11. Transfer 500 uL of Duke, ViaComp to a flow tube
  12. Controls run order: PBS, Duke, unstained M9, unstained TSB, blank rinse, matrix, ViaComp, fixed (very important due to probe!!)
  13. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    3. Read two times 
  14. Prepare sample tubes
    1. Weigh empty tubes
    2. Add 900 uL Staining buffer to each tube
    3. Weigh
    4. Add 100 uL cells to each tube (5e6 - 1e7 cell/mL)
    5. Weigh
    6. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (3) Staining Buffer Mass (2) Notes
      M9_A 1.1085 2.1112 2.0078  
      M9_B 1.0861 2.0858 1.9849  
      M9_C 1.0856 2.0856 1.9842  
      TSB_A 1.0954 2.0942 1.9935  
      TSB_B 1.0800 2.0792 1.9790  
      TSB_C 1.1016 2.0953 1.9997  
  15. Incubate tubes, target 30 min
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
    2. Start time: 12:54 pm
    3. End time: 1:34 pm
  16. Prepare sample flow tubes
    1. Weigh empty tubes
    2. Add 400 uL PBS to each tube
    3. Weigh
    4. Add 50 uL CBP to each tube after vortexing
    5. Weigh 
    6. Add 50 uL cells to each tube (5e5 - 1e6 cell/mL)
    7. Weigh
    8. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (4) PBS Mass (2) CBP Mass (3) Notes
      M9_A 3.4765 3.9959 3.8902 3.9398  
      M9_B 3.4646 3.9646 3.8679 3.9131  
      M9_C 3.4753 3.9718 3.8739 3.9228  
      TSB_A 3.4790 3.9754 3.8747 3.9263  
      TSB_B 3.4862 -- 3.8678 3.9142  
      TSB_C 3.4827 3.9693 3.8778 3.9232  
  17. Prepare samples to be run in random order, keep observation reps together
    1. Order: TSB_A, M9_C, M9_A, TSB_B, M9_B, TSB_C
  18. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    3. Run 2x more for observational replicate
  19. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  20. Shutdown
  21. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  22. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

  • Missed measurement of one final tube. Will need to make sure that volume adjustment is either set to 1 or kept off the analysis

title: 2024.08.05 E.coli RM on CytoFLEX
body:
Purpose:

  • Practice for characterizing E.coli material for RM, using old materials

 

Sample starting material(s): 

 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
RCP Consumable - RainbowBeads_AN04   Person - Kirsten Parratt
Duke Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464    
Matrix MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_QuickMeltMatrix_PS42281   Person - Sandra Da Silva
VC Consumable - ViaComp_SSB07A_211104 Previously estimated 6e4 particle/drop, adding to 100 uL gives ~e5 particle/mL Person - Kirsten Parratt
Fixed TBS_NIST_Fixed

This material estimated at 2.33e8 cell/mL in: Ready for export - 2024.07.03 CytoFLEX GC+MDiS

 Person - Sandra Da Silva
CBP Consumable - CBPBeads_2707082   Person - Kirsten Parratt
Test

MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli120hr_PS49921;

MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBEcoli120hr_PS48791

   Person - Sandra Da Silva

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
    1. Water tube for volume calibration
    2. QC beads
    3. RCP
    4. Duke beads
    5. CBP
    6. ViaComp 
    7. Fixed cells
    8. Centrifuge tubes: Consumable - MicrocentrifugeTube_Avantor_10025-724
    9. Flow tubes: Consumable - FlowTube_FalconPolystyrene_352054
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up (9:50 am)
    2. Run a volume calibration experiment
      1. Link: In prep - CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
    3. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    4. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 1  
      VSSC 20 4000 - H, Width
      NUV450 25  
      B525 50  
      Y585 50  
    5. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead scatter gate 
  4. Prepare the stock of Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464
    1. (~ 8.43e8 bead/mL from Ready for export - 2024.07.30 BSA + Bead Sample Prep)
    2. Vortex 30 sec
    3. Add 2 drops to tube (note: this happened about an hour before further dilution)\
    4. Dilute 10 uL beads into 990 uL PBS (~8.43 e6 bead/mL)
  5. Rehydrate the matrix tube in 1 mL PBS
    1. Mass before = 1.8773
    2. Mass after = 2.8824
  6. Rehydrate the sample tubes in 1 mL PBS/tube (~5e7 - 1e8 cell/mL)
    1. Mass_M9 before = 1.8674
    2. Mass_TSB before = 1.8078
    3. Time = 10:57 am
    4. Mass_M9 after = 2.8655
    5. Mass_TSB after = 2.8092
  7. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Dilute 10 uL Consumable - Hoechst in 90 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Will have four control types (pbs, matrix, viacomp, fixed) + 2 types of sample (M9, TSB) * 3 sample replicates = 10 tubes
    3. Make 11 mL of PBS with 2*11 uL HWS (22 uL HWS)
  8. Aliquot into 4 tubes such that total is 1 mL
    1.  Add Staining buffer to each tube
    2. Weigh
    3. Add cells to each tube (11:56 am)
    4. Weigh
    5. Tube Empty Tube Mass Sample (uL) Target Sample mass Staining Buffer (uL) Target Staining Buffer Mass
      Duke 1.1006 10 2.0983 990 2.0880
      PBS -- 0 -- 1000 --
      Unstained M9 1.0700 100 2.0510 900 - PBS 1.9519
      Unstained TSB 1.0863 100 2.0814 900 - PBS 1.9803
      Matrix 1.0838 100 2.0761 900 1.9754
      ViaComp -- 2 drops -- 200 uL --
      Fixed 1.0902 50 2.0406 900 1.9884
  9. Incubate tubes, target 30 min
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
    2. Start time: 12:01 pm
    3. End time: 12:35 pm
  10. Prepare unstained/matrix sample flow tubes
    1. Add 400 uL PBS to each tube
    2. Weigh
    3. Add 50 uL cells to each tube (5e5 - 1e6 cell/mL)
    4. Weigh
    5. Add 50 uL CBP to each tube after vortexing
    6. Weigh 
    7. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (4) PBS Mass (2) CBP Mass (3) Notes
      PBS          Next time!
      Unstained M9 3.4805 3.9809 3.8809 3.9316  
      Unstained TSB 3.4685 3.9679 3.8677 3.9189  
      Matrix 3.4615 3.9611 3.8621 3.9120  
      Fixed 3.4766 3.9777 3.8768 3.9262 Needed to make fresh samples due to bleach, doesn't match
  11. Transfer 500 uL of PBS, Duke, ViaComp to a flow tube
  12. Controls run order: PBS, Duke, unstained M9, unstained TSB, blank rinse, ViaComp, fixed, matrix (very important due to probe!!)
  13. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    3. Read two times 
  14. Prepare sample tubes
    1. Add 900 uL Staining buffer to each tube
    2. Weigh
    3. Add 100 uL cells to each tube (5e6 - 1e7 cell/mL)
    4. Weigh
    5. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (3) Staining Buffer Mass (2) Notes
      M9_A 1.0914 2.0916 1.9929  
      M9_B 1.0896 2.0919 1.9931  
      M9_C 1.0897 2.0891 1.9931 This is not a typo
      TSB_A 1.1034 2.1076 2.0063  
      TSB_B 1.0865 2.0792 1.9778  
      TSB_C 1.0824 2.0843 1.9854  
  15. Incubate tubes, target 30 min
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
    2. Start time: 1:40 pm
    3. End time: 2:12 pm
  16. Prepare sample flow tubes
    1. Add 400 uL PBS to each tube
    2. Weigh
    3. Add 50 uL cells to each tube (5e5 - 1e6 cell/mL)
    4. Weigh
    5. Add 50 uL CBP to each tube after vortexing
    6. Weigh 
    7. Tube Empty Tube Mass (1) Sample mass (4) PBS Mass (2) CBP Mass (3) Notes
      M9_A 3.4774 3.9758 3.8787 3.9273  
      M9_B 3.4758 3.9756 3.8770 3.9266  
      M9_C 3.4693 3.9713 3.8704 3.9231  
      TSB_A 3.4641 3.9642 3.8652 3.9159  
      TSB_B 3.4551 3.9553 3.8550 3.9053  
      TSB_C 3.4770 3.9797 3.8788 3.9296  
  17. Prepare samples to be run in random order, keep observation reps together
    1. Order: M9_B, TSB_A, M9_C, TSB_C, M9_A, TSB_B
  18. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    3. Run 2x more for observational replicate
  19. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  20. Shutdown
  21. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  22. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

  • Challenge conditions that could be added: flow rate change, gain change, long run time, missing bead spike, extra bead spike, low Hoechst concentration
  • ViaComp number needs to hit 10k for good characterization, likely a little low this time

title: CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
body:
Purpose:

  • Calibrate Instrument - CytoFLEX volume measurements

 

Protocol:

  1. Start up the instrument
  2. System startup wizard
  3. Prepare 1 mL Consumable - SterileWater in flow tube
  4. Record mass of tube "before" 
    1. 4.4744 g
  5. Run volume calibration wizard
  6. Record mass of tube "after"
    1. 4.2905 g
  7. Determine whether calibration has passed

Observations:

title: 2024.08.06 LogCOMET B. spiz CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Make flow cytometry measurement of In prep - 2024.08.06 LogCOMET_SamplePrep

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner(s)
1:18  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture  

·       Cells are B. spizizinii (ATCC 6633, BSL1). Preparation is from TSA agar plate culture, contains spores and heat-treated vegetative cells.

·       Spore clean-up for samples and surfaces is 30 min treatment with fresh 10% bleach

·       KP will hand each participant 18 tubes (1.6 mL eppendorfs for BactoBox, 0.6 mL eppendorfs for everyone else) containing cell samples

·       Each tube is labeled “S#”. This corresponds to the sample number, there are 1 - 18

·       Each tube is also labeled “r1” or “r2”. This tells you the number of replicate observations that will be generated, either 1 or 2

·       Store at 4C until ready to use

  Person - Alshae' Logan

Reference flow plots:

  • From Ready for export - 2024.05.24 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Vybrant Test
  • Note these were with Consumable - CBF555 so the read out is Y585

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex 
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions
    1. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Trigger -H = 1e4, -W
      NUV450 25  
      R660 200  
      V450 200 *Just for interest
      B525 200 *Just for interest
      Y675 200 *Just for interest
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS: Dilute 5 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 45 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
  6. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (18 samples +1)*987 uL buffer = 18.753 mL PBS
    2. 38 uL HWS
  7. Prepare samples
    1. Unstained: 990 uL PBS + 10 uL Cell sample (S1) 
    2. Duke beads: 990 uL PBS + 10 uL stock
    3. Probe: 990 uL staining buffer
    4. Samples: 990 uL staining buffer + 10 uL cells
    5. Move to incubator for 30 min
      1. Start time -  10:58 am
      2. End time -  11:29 am
  8. For each sample tube: 
    1. Run order: PBS, Duke beads,Unst, ProbeOnly, samples
      1. Ran the Duke beads directly from microcentrifuge tube
    2. Vortex the tube
    3. Transfer 500 uL to flow tube 
    4. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    5. Repeat if second observation called for
  9. Wanted to quickly check Consumable - CBPBeads_2539840 in flow tubes (Consumable - FlowTube_FalconPolystyrene_352054) vs microcentrifuge tubes (Consumable - MicrocentrifugeTube_Avantor_10025-724)
    1. Prep two solutions in microcentrifuge tubes
    2. 900 uL PBS + 100 uL Consumable - CBPBeads_2539840
    3. 850 uL PBS + 50 uL Consumable - 7.5%BSASolution_Borrowed + ~100 uL Consumable - CBPBeads_2539840 (bottle ran out during aliquoting)
    4. For each of the mixes, split 500 uL off to a flow tube
      1. 12:33 pm, RT
    5. Run on cytometer
      1. 2:54 pm
  10.  Cleanup
    1. **Note: 30 min with fresh 10% Consumable - Bleach for all surfaces**
    2. Run 10 min bleach and rinse with 10 min water
    3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
    4. Shutdown
    5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
    6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

  • Should have continued with 30 uL/min for 2 min instead of 10 uL/min for 3 min to get higher counts
  •

title: 2024.07.31 Tween80 + Bead Sample Prep
body:
Purpose:

  • Build off results from yesterday's experiment ( Ready for export - 2024.07.30 BSA + Bead Sample Prep) where BSA did not matter and Tween might have
  • Note that I tried something very similar in March 2022 with TruCount beads (and homemade BSA). At the time, BSA did not make a large difference until higher concentrations and the addition of Consumable - Tween80 may have helped further. Results in that experiment were also all undercounts by ~5%  which suggests a volume calibration issue instead. 2% BSA + 1% Tween80 was the winner in that experiment

 

Protocol:

 

  1. Turn on CytoFLEX
    1. System start up
    2. Daily QC
  2. I had previously made a Tween80 solution at 2 %
  3. Dilute into 5 microcentrifuge tubes 
    1. Tube Tween80 Stock (uL) PBS (uL) %
      A 500 500 1
      B 250 750 0.25
      C 500 500 0.125
      D 100 900 0.0125
      E 0 1000 0
  4. Pipette 450 uL into flow tubes
  5. Obtain Consumable - CBPBeads_2707082 
    1. 0.53e5 bead/50 uL --> Expecting 9540 bead in the 90 uL acquisition volume
  6. For each sample, starting from E and working to A
    1. Vortex CBP for 30 sec
    2. Add 50 uL directly to flow tube and pipette to mix
    3. Acquire tube for 3 min at 30 uL/min
      1. Naming convention "Letter_SampleRep_ObsRep"
    4. Vortex tube such that fluid goes all the way up the tube
    5. Take a second observation
  7. Make a mix of Tween80 and BSA
    1. 250 uL of Consumable - 7.5%BSASolution_Borrowed
    2. 500 uL of Consumable - Tween80
    3. 250 uL PBS
    4. Should give 1% T80 + 1.875 % BSA
  8. Try the mix on CBP (same dilution) and also a tube of (old) TruCount to see if that makes a difference
    1. Target for the TC was 46550, added 450 uL --> Target 9310 
  9. TruCount gets much closer than CBP for the same mix solution
    1. Diluted the "Mix" 1:10 and made another TC tube 
  10. Daily Clean
  11. Shutdown CytoFLEX

 

Observations/Questions/Follow up:

  • Yesterday's samples were ~5000 events out of 6300 expected (80%), saw the same for E_1_1
  • Scatter seems messy for E_1, even after bleach run. Possibly due to leftover BSA? Could run a deep clean.
  • [Tween80] also doesn't seem to matter
  • Previous work I did seems to have gone up to 20 mg/mL BSA to get necessary result
    •  
  • TruCount has noticeable doublets in Mix, when backcalculated gets within 5% of the target
  • Talk to Dean Ripple's group about bead count
  • Reach out to Thermo about their bead count validation method

 

Analysis Plans:

  • Count per sample, as a function of [Tween] or sample replicate number
  • Variability in counts
  • What are the abort rates per file?
  • Amount of Tween scatter in approximate cell gating region per concentration
  • Does amount of Tween scatter change over time? (ie Is it carrying over?)

title: 2024.08.06 LogCOMET_SamplePrep
body:
Purpose:

  • Prepare MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Project - LogCOMET dilutions

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner

TSA-14-1:2-1:3
MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture

Ready for export - June 2024-B. spizizenii sporulation protocol

 

Took the same amount from each tube

 Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

 

2024.08.05

Preparation:

  1. Label 19 1.5 mL stock tubes with 1:19 
    1. Stock solutions will be prepared in these 
    2. Stock will be aliquoted to samples for BactoBox, CFU, Coulter, Flow
    3. Extra tube is for Duke Beads
  2. Label operator sample tubes
    1. Label 2 sets of 18 microcentrifuge tubes (1.6 mL volume) with 1:18 (CFU, flow staining) 
    2. Label 3 sets of 19 microcentrifuge tubes (1.6 mL volume) with 1:19 (BactoBox, Coulter, flow)   
    3. Label each tube to indicate 1 or 2 replicate observations 
  3. Prelabel 24 1.6mL Eppendorf tubes for Flow (samples, probe control, unstained, bleach, pbs, Duke)
  4. Prelabel 24 cytometer tubes for Flow 
  5. Prelabel 20 Acuvettes for Coulter (1 blank, 1 Duke, 18 samples)
  6. Prelabel 32 15 mL tubes for BactoBox (1 blank, 1 Duke, 18 samples)
  7. Prepare 155 plates of appropriate agar Consumable - TSA (Person - Monique Hunter)
  8. Confirm volume calibration on Instrument - CytoFLEX

  

2024.08.06

Preparing Dilutions:

  1. Obtain filtered Consumable - 1:9 PBS Dilution from Person - Alshae' Logan that has passed conductivity check
  2. Concentrate stock sample to starting concentration of 2e8 cell/mL in PBS in 5 mL
    1. Start 7:50 am
    2. Need a total of 10 e8 cells, will take 8.5 mL of stock solution
    3. Add 1.42 mL/tube to 6 tubes
    4. Spin at 10k x g for 5 min
    5. Resuspend each tube in 833.3 uL PBS
    6. Pool tubes 
  3. See GUI for generating dilutions
  4. For each tube
    1. Pipette the indicated media volume
    2. Invert the tightly closed cell stock x2 to mix
    3. Pipetted the indicated cell volume
    4. Record time
  5. Transfer appropriate amount from the stock dilution samples to an eppendorf each for BactoBox, CFU, Coulter, Flow
    1. Instrument Volume per sample tube (uL)
      BactoBox 400
      CFU 100
      Coulter 250
      Flow 100
  1. Prepare the stock of Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464
    1. ~ 8.43e8 bead/mL from Ready for export - 2024.07.30 BSA + Bead Sample Prep
    2. Dilute 118.6 uL into 881.3 uL PBS (~1 e6 bead/mL)
    3. Split into aliquots for participants, 250 uL each
  2. Give to each participant
    1. Store at 4C until transferred to participant
    2. Record time

 

Sample end material(s): 

Copy this final sample table to subsequent record(s)

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner(s)
1:18  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture  

·       Cells are B. spizizinii (ATCC 6633, BSL1). Preparation is from TSA agar plate culture, contains spores and heat-treated vegetative cells.

·       Spore clean-up for samples and surfaces is 30 min treatment with fresh 10% bleach

·       KP will hand each participant 18 tubes (1.6 mL eppendorfs for BactoBox, 0.6 mL eppendorfs for everyone else) containing cell samples

·       Each tube is labeled “S#”. This corresponds to the sample number, there are 1 - 18

·       Each tube is also labeled “r1” or “r2”. This tells you the number of replicate observations that will be generated, either 1 or 2

·       Store at 4C until ready to use

  Person - Alshae' Logan, Person - Joy Dunkers, Person - Monique Hunter, Person - Kirsten Parratt; Person - Ian Hines

*TSA-14-1-1 (remade sample) MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture 227/B255   H+_10jul_B255_1_3 Person - Joy Dunkers

 

 

Reference flow plots

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex 
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions
    1. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Trigger -H = 1e4, -W
      NUV450 25  
      R660 200  
      V450 200  
      B525 200  
      Y675 200  
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare unstained control: 5 ul B. spiziz in 495 ul PBS
  6. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS Dilute 10 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 90 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
  7. Previous samples around 5e8 - 1e9 cell/mL
    1. Dilute a sample 1:100 (5 ul sample in 495 ul PBS)
    2. Run unstained control to estimate cell number
  8. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (# samples +1)*  uL buffer =13 * 0.5= 6.5 mL PBS (to achieve necessary dilution based on unstained count)
    2. 2 uL HWS per 1 mL buffer
  9. Aliquot 495 uL staining buffer into 12 prelabeled 1.6 mL tubes
  10. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add 5 uL cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  11. Incubate tubes for 30 min
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
  12. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer 500 uL cells to flow tube 
    3. Run on cytometer for 2 min at 10 uL/min
  13. Cleanup
    1. **Note: 30 min with fresh 10% Consumable - Bleach for all surfaces**
    2. Run 10 min bleach and rinse with 10 min water
    3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
    4. Shutdown
    5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
    6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

Observations:

  • One tube was remade due to unexpectedly low counts, remake was still low. Didn't investigate further, data look normal otherwise

 

Results:

(67573 events/20uL)*1000 uL/mL*(500/5 dilution) --> Around 1.12 e8 cell/mL [[This is for 10July_B139_C]]

title: 2024.07.17 CytoFLEX GC+MDiS VybrantGreen
body:
Purpose:

  • Repeat a previous experiment (Ready for export - 2024.07.03 CytoFLEX GC+MDiS) but with Consumable - VDG_2836713 dye instead of Hoechst

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
M9_MB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229 Fixed In prep - 2024.06.26 FormaldehydeFixation Person - Joy Dunkers
TSB_MB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBecoli72hr_PS4155 Fixed In prep - 2024.06.26 FormaldehydeFixation Person - Joy Dunkers
M9_NIST MicrobialMaterial - NIST0056 Fixed 2024.07.02. 72 hr growth prepared on 12/08/22 Person - Sandra Da Silva
TSB_NIST MicrobialMaterial - NIST0056 Fixed 2024.07.02. 72 hr growth prepared on 12/08/22 Person - Sandra Da Silva

Reference for Sandra's cells:

 

Protocol:

  1. Prep Instrument - CytoFLEX
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
      1. NOTE: B610 refused to pass QC but was very close
    3. Turn on all the channels just in case
    4. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 -W; Trigger 4e4 -H
      NUV450 25  
      B525 100  
      Y585 200  
      R660 200  
    5. Run Consumable - Bleach 10% and PBS to prep
      1. Filtered the PBS in BSC, 0.22 um
    6. Measure PBS to check event rate is low
  2. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate (RCP-30-5A, Lot# AN04)
  3. Dilute all samples to ~ 2e6 cell/mL
    1. Tube Cell to add (uL) PBS (mL)
      M9_MB 27.65 4.973
      TSB_MB 31.39 4.969
      M9_NIST 113.0 4.887
      TSB_NIST 42.85 4.958
    2. Equation (2e6 cell/mL)*(5 mL) = (estimate concentration in stock)*(dilute volume)
    3. Note this is PBS for this experiment
  4. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Try 1 uL of Vybrant Green Consumable - VDG_2836713 per 5 mL cells
    2. Previously Joy used 1 uL for all 500 uL of stock (higher cell number overall, lower volume)
  5. Incubate tubes
    1. 21 C, atmospheric, Instrument - Rocker_A140, protected from light
    2. Start time:  1:53 pm
    3. End time:  2:23 pm
  6. Transfer 200 uL samples to tube
  7. Prepare another set with 10x less concentrated VDG
  8. Incubate tubes
    1. 21 C, atmospheric, Instrument - Rocker_A140, protected from light
    2. Start time:  2:56 pm
    3. End time: 3:28  pm
  9. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  10. Shutdown
  11. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  12. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

  • Solutions are visibly pink for sample set 1 (higher VDG concentration), not for sample set 2
  • Set 1 has high background/debris staining
  • Set 2 has less background/debris staining but cells seem unsaturated.
  • MB-produced samples don't look as distinct as when we looked on the SRT with VDG or as last week with the Hoechst. Why?

title: June 2024-B. spizizenii sporulation protocol
body:
Spore harvest done on  7/10/24, spore processing done on 7/11/24.

 

Sample table:

Incubator Replicate 1 Replicate 2 Replicate 3
227 TSA-14-1-1 TSA-14-1-2 TSA-14-1-3
224 TSA-14-2-1 TSA-14-2-2 TSA-14-2-3

 

  1. Initiate Growth
    1. Inoculate 10 mL sterile trypticase soy broth (TSB) Consumable - TSB with B. spizizenii  Manufactured Material - ATCC_6633_Subculture 
      1. From Liquid Stock: inoculate with 10 µL  
      2. From Agar Plate: inoculate with single colony using a 10 µl sterile loop 
    2. Vortex suspension and incubate dynamically at approximately 150 rpm at 35 ± 1 °C for 24 ± 4 hours. 
  2. Spore Propagation
    1. Obtain the incubated culture from section 5.1.1.2.  
    2. Spread plate 100 µL from the initial growth culture onto a sterile spore plate. Consumable - TSA or Consumable - Difco Amended Sporulation Agar (ANA) Recipe
    3. Incubate plates upright at room temperature until the sample has absorbed into the media. 
    4. Incubate the plates inverted at 35 ± 1 °C for 14 days ± 4 hours. 
    5. Follow procedure for heat killing vegetative cells
  3. Spore Harvest and Purification
    1. Using a sterile inoculation loop, rubber policeman, or cell scraper to scrape the B. spizizenii (ATCC 6633) lawn off of the TSA or amended nutrient agar (ANA) plates and suspend in 10 mL sterile, DI water. Take care not to damage the agar.
    2. Vortex agitate the cell suspension for 10 seconds.
    3. Store suspension at 4 + 2 °C for 24 ± 4 hours. 
    4. Heat the cell suspension in a 70 ± 5 °C water bath for 1 hour ± 5 minutes. 
    5. Centrifuge the cell suspension 3,000 rcf for 10 minutes
    6. Aspirate and discard the supernatant 
    7. Prepare 10 ml of filter sterilized lysozyme solution (60 µg/mL) in 10 mM tris-HCl Buffer, pH 7.4 for each suspension. Consumable - Sterile lysozyme solution for B. spizizenii spore processing Freshly prepare day of test.
    8. Add 10 mL 60 µg/mL lysozyme to the cell pellet. Vortex agitate for 10 seconds. 
    9. Incubate the cells at 36 ± 1 °C for 1 hour ± 5 minutes. 
    10. Centrifuge the cell suspension at 3,000 rcf for 10 minutes. 
    11. Discard supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 10 mL sterile DI water.
    12. Centrifuge the cell suspension at 3,000 rcf for 10 minutes. 
    13. Prepare a 10 ml filter-sterilized Consumable - Sodium n-dodecyl sulfate (SDS), 20% aq. soln.  (0.05% weight/volume Consumable - 0.05% Sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS) solution for B. spizizenii spore processing) in DI water for each suspension. 
    14. Discard supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 10 mL of 0.05% SDS
    15. Vortex agitate the cell suspension for 10 seconds
    16. Centrifuge the cell suspension at 3,200 +/- 200 rcf for 10 minutes
    17. Discard supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 10 mL of sterile DI water
    18. Repeat the previous two steps 1 additional time
    19. At this point, the suspension may be stored at 2-8 °C

Further characterization work to be done:

1. Flow cytometry- total count, spore purity
2. Coulter counter- total cell count
3. Bactobox- intact and total count
4. Microscopy-spore purity
5. CFU- % germination. Separate calculations using Coulter, Bacto and flow 

Link to these experiments once entered into elabs.

    1. 4.8239 g
  7. Determine whether calibration has passed

title: 2024.07.03 CytoFLEX GC+MDiS
body:
Purpose:

  • Enumerate and characterize cell samples prepared for Greg Cooksey/Matt DiSalvo test of serial cytometry on microbes

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
M9_MB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229 Fixed In prep - 2024.06.26 FormaldehydeFixation Person - Joy Dunkers
TSB_MB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBecoli72hr_PS4155 Fixed In prep - 2024.06.26 FormaldehydeFixation Person - Joy Dunkers
M9_NIST MicrobialMaterial - NIST0056 Fixed 2024.07.02. 72 hr growth prepared on 12/08/22 Person - Sandra Da Silva
TSB_NIST MicrobialMaterial - NIST0056 Fixed 2024.07.02. 72 hr growth prepared on 12/08/22 Person - Sandra Da Silva

Reference for Sandra's cells:

 

Protocol:

Day 1 - 2024/07/03

  1. Prep Instrument - CytoFLEX
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run volume calibration Ready for export - 2024.07.03 CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
    4. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 -W; Trigger 4e4 -H
      NUV450 25  
      B525 200  
      Y585 200  
      R660 200  
    5. Run Consumable - Bleach 10% and PBST to prep
      1. Filtered the PBST in BSC, 0.22 um
    6. Measure PBST to check event rate is low
  2. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate (RCP-30-5A, Lot# AN04)
  3. Estimate of cell count for each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex cell stock 
    2. Add 2 cells to 198 uL PBST
    3. Vortex
    4. Acquire at 10 uL/min for 3 min, 2x
    5. Tube  Count 1 (Scatter+) Count 2 (Scatter+) Estimate in stock (cell/mL)
      PBST 32420*180/600= 9726 -- 3.24E+07
      M9_MB 106913 110016 3.62E+08
      TSB_MB 94572 96564 3.19E+08
      M9_NIST 24823 28259 8.85E+07
      TSB_NIST 67097 72900 2.33E+08
    6. Estimate from (average count/30 uL acquired)*(1e3 uL/mL)*(200/2 dilution)
  4. Dilute all samples to ~ 2e6 cell/mL
    1. Tube Cell to add (uL) PBST (mL)
      M9_MB 27.65 4.973
      TSB_MB 31.39 4.969
      M9_NIST 113.0 4.887
      TSB_NIST 42.85 4.958
    2. Equation (2e6 cell/mL)*(5 mL) = (estimate concentration in stock)*(dilute volume)
  5. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Generally 2 uL 1:10 Consumable - Hoechst per 1e7 cell 
    2. Previously 2 uL Consumable - CBF640 for 5e6 cell B. spiz. Try similar here. Reconstituted 2024/06/18
    3. For 4 tubes, mix 10 uL each reagent
    4. Add 4 uL to each diluted cell tube
  6. Incubate tubes
    1. 21 C, atmospheric, Instrument - Rocker_A140, protected from light
    2. Start time: 12:46 pm
    3. End time: 1:25 pm
  7. Transfer 200 uL samples to tube
  8. Tube Count Estimate in stock
    M9_MB_St 54642 1.82E+06
    TSB_MB_St 63812 2.13E+06
    M9_NIST_St 34868 1.16E+06
    TSB_NIST_St 42146 1.40E+06
  9. Clean with bleach and rinse with PBST
  10. Prepare alternate staining buffer with no CBF
    1. Prepare replicate dilutions
    2. Add 2 uL undiluted Hoechst to each cell tube
  11. Incubate tubes
    1. 21 C, atmospheric, Instrument - Rocker_A140, protected from light
    2. Start time: 1:48 pm
    3. End time:  2:18 pm
  12. Transfer 200 uL samples to tube
  13. Tube Count Estimate in stock
    M9_MB_H 55231 1.84 e6
    TSB_MB_H 60436 2e6
    M9_NIST_H 34418 1.14e6
    TSB_NIST_H 42812 1.43e6
  14. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
  15. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  16. Shutdown
  17. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  18. Confirm that fixation was successful
    1. Prepare 7 tubes of 5 mL Consumable - TSB (media is old 2021)
      1. TSB Negative Control (no cells)
      2. TSB Positive Control - MicrobialMaterial - NIST0056 cells from 2023/12/22 test
      3. PBST Negative Control (no cells)
      4. 4 tubes for 4 fixed samples
    2. Vortex prepped tubes
    3. Transfer 10 uL per test sample to culture tube
    4. Place in incubator: 37C, static
  19. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

Day 2 - 2024/07/09

  1. Remove tubes from the incubator
  2. For each tube, vortex and image (see attached)
  3. Dispose of as biohazardous waste

 

 

Observations:

  • CBF concentration still too high
  • H/CBF stained samples not giving expected NUV450 distribution compared to SRT demo in B525/Vybrant (not sure Sandra/Joy's staining conditions)
  • Hoechst only looks much better. Use this.
  • Nothing grew except the positive control

title: 2024.06.26 FormaldehydeFixation
body:
Purpose:

  • Use formaldehyde to stop cell growth
  • Samples will be stained with Consumable - Hoechst and shared with Matt/Greg Cooksey for serial cytometry

 

Sample starting material(s): 

 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
M9 broth MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229 These are stored in original packaging in 224/A140 fridge labeled with Joy's name Person - Sandra Da Silva
TSB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBecoli72hr_PS4155 These are stored in original packaging in 224/A140 fridge labeled with Joy's name Person - Sandra Da Silva

 

Protocol:

 

Gather the reagents and supplies:

1.            Consumable - 37%FormaldehydeSolution
2.            0.1 µm filtered Consumable - PBS_10x
3.            Consumable - NucleaseFreeWater
4.            200 or 300 & 1000 µl filter-tip pipettes
5.            Instrument - Rocker_A140
6.            Instrument - Microcentrifuge_A140

 

Make the fixation buffer:

Note: To scale up the recipe below, multiple the volumes of individual reagents by the total volume in mL + 5% excess 


For a final volume of 1.0 mL, mix:
o    100 ul Consumable - 37%FormaldehydeSolution
o    100 uL Consumable - PBS_10x
o    0.750 mL Consumable - NucleaseFreeWater

This will give a final solution of 3.7% v/v formaldehyde in 1X PBS when mixed with 50 uL of cells

 

Fix the cells:

  1. Resuspend pellet in 1 ml PBS
  2. Centrifuge 5000 x g for 4 min
  3. For each cell sample to be fixed, reduce to 50 uL volume
    1. Remove 750 ul supernatant with 1000 ul pipette
    2. Remove 200 ul supernatant with 200 or 300 ul pipette
  4. Add 100 µL freshly prepared fixation buffer, pipette mix, add 850 µL fixation buffer
  5. Vortex
  6. Mix on a Instrument - Rocker_A140 at room temperature for 60 minutes
  7. Pellet the cells by centrifugation (4 minutes, 5000 × g) at RT Instrument - Microcentrifuge_A140
  8. Remove supernatant- 800 µL, then 2x 100 µL
  9. Wash the cells in 500 mL 1× PBS by doing the following
    1. Resuspend first in 100 µl 1X PBS, pipette mix,  then add 400 µl 1X PBS
    2. Centrifuge at 4500×g for 5 min
    3. Aspirate supernatant
    4. Repeat step for a second wash
  10. After step 7a-c has been done twice, add 100 µL PBS, pipette mix, then add 400 µL PBS, pipette mix
  11. Store in fridge

 

Sample end material(s):

Protocol:

 

2024.06.24

Preparation:

  1. Label 18 10 mL orange cap tubes with 1:18 
    1. Stock solutions will be prepared in these 
    2. Stock will be aliquoted to samples for BactoBox, CFU, Coulter, Flow
  2. Label 4 sets of 18 microcentrifuge tubes (1.6 mL volume) with 1:18  
    1. Label each tube to indicate 1 or 2 replicate observations 
  3. Prelabel 22 1.6mL Eppendorf tubes for Flow 
  4. Prelabel 22 cytometer tubes for Flow 
  5. Prelabel 18 Acuvettes for Coulter 
  6. Prepare 31 square plates of appropriate agar Consumable - TSA (Person - Monique Hunter)

  

2024.06.25

Preparing Dilutions:

  1. Obtain filtered Consumable - 1:9 PBS Dilution from Person - Alshae' Logan
  2. Dilute spore stock solution from approximately 5e8 cell/mL (could be previously counted with flow) to starting concentration of 2e8 cell/mL in PBS
    1. Dilute 2.4 mL cells into 3.6 mL PBS
    2. Record time - 
  3. See GUI for generating dilutions

title: LogCOMET2 B. spiziz Coulter 6/25/2024
body:
Purpose:

  • To count B. spizizenii in a dilution series and compare with flow cytometer (Cytoflex), other impedance counter (Bactobox) and CFU.

 

Sample starting material(s): 

from: In prep - 2024.06.25 LogCOMET_SamplePrep

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
TSA B. spizizinii Rep B 1-24 MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

  1. Run system startup. Using 30 um aperture. 
  2. Run system QC with size calibration beads (create a consumable resource for 5 um beads)
    1. Record previous kd from logbook here: 44.199
    2. Record current kd here: 43.546 (-1.5%). 
    3. Record current kd in logbook as well
  3. Optional: Run system QC with concentration calibration beads Reagent - Conc.QCBead_Coulter
    1. Record standard conc. here: 5 x 10^8 beads/ml (conc: 10 ul of Duke 2.0 um std beads in 10 ml saline). 
    2. Record conc. measured from run here: Did not run concentration beads this time
  4. Obtain saline buffer Consumable - BaxterSaline
  5. Prefill sample Accuvettes w/ 9.87 g (9.9 mL) + 0.05 g 0.1 mm filtered Baxter saline. Include 1 blank and 3 rinsing Accuvettes 
  6. Obtain samples and store at 4C until ready. Record time placed in 4C. 
  7. Run 3 saline blanks and evaluate debris tail. If small enough, continue experiment. If debris tail is large, clean system. 
  8. In Coulter SOM menu, set sample volume= 0.1 mL, Analytic volume= 100 uL, and make sure the acquisition setting is set to volumetric
  9. Prepare each Accuvette right before Coulter run and measure each tube in numeric order.
    1. Dilute 100 uL cells (#B. spizizenii) into prefilled Accuvette. Pipette mix tube. 
  10. Acquire data. Measure each tube in numerical order. Use naming convention provided by K. Parratt.
  11. Evaluate the number of particles in peak. If <2000 particles/ml, then increase sample analytical volume toward achieving minimum count. System may clog with increased analytical volumes.  
  12. Rinsing step: Insert Accuvette with clean saline while preparing next sample. Do not blot aperture tube with tissue which releases dust. 
  13. If sample tube indicates two replicate observations, repeat read with same cuvette (e.g. “S1 r2” tube will generate samples S1R1 and S1R2)  
  14. Shutdown and dispose of biohazardous waste per SOP
  15. Clean up and dispose of waste per SOP
  16. Transfer all files to the shared folder: Coulter 
  17. Data analysis in Shiny

Purpose:

Sample starting material(s):

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
       
       
       
       
...      

 

Protocol

Day1

  1. Obtain reporting spreadsheet 

  1. Obtain cell samples and store at 4C until ready 

  1. Record time 

  1. Prepare agar plates for use (warm or dry as needed) 

  1. Obtain two 96 well plates to follow the layout here:  

  1. Obtain new bottle of PBS 

  1. Add 180 uL PBS to all labeled wells 

  1. Prepare samples in the order noted on tubes (sample 1, then 2, etc), for each sample tube: 

  1. Remove from fridge 

  1. Record time 

  1. Vortex the cell stock 

  1. Add 20 uL to the prelabeled well (this makes a 10^-1 dilution) 

  1. If sample tube indicates two replicate observations (e.g. “S1 r2” tube will generate wells S1R1 and S1R2), plate the row onto two agar plates 

  1. Use a multi-pipetter set to 20 uL to serially dilute across the labeled wells for all samples (will generate 10^-2, -3, -4 etc. dilutions) 

  1. Create drip plates for all samples 

  1. Label the agar plate with sample number, replicate observation number 

  1. Pipette up and down in the wells containing 10^-2, -3, -4, -5, -6 dilutions 

  1. Pipette 10 uL from wells containing 10^-2, -3, -4, -5, -6 dilutions onto agar 

  1. Drip plate 

  1. Record time 

  1. Also prepare one plate using the diluent PBS as a negative control 

  1. Record time that samples are placed in incubator ____3:30pm______ 

  1. Record incubator conditions (Temp _37C_, Humidity _Need_, Atmosphere _Atmospheric_) 

  1. Dispose of all biohazardous waste and clean up 

  1. Culture plates overnight 

  1. Obtain supplies
    1. 1X PBS used for dilutions (made using 10X PBS cat#46-013-CM lot: 00219006 from Corning
    2. 31 TSA plates
  2. Prepare dilutions
    1. List dilution conditions. refer to protocol 2024.06.25 LogCOMET Full Protocol.docx
  3. Plate dilutions
  4. Store in incubator
    1. Temperature: 37C
    2. Humidity: n/a
    3. Atmosphere: aerobic
    4. Start time: 3:30pm
  5. Dispose of biohazardous waste and clean up per SOP

 

 

Day2

  1. Obtain samples from incubator
    1. 8:37AM
  2. For each plate
    1. Record count
    2. (Optional) Record image
  3. Dispose of biohazardous waste and clean up per SOP

title: 2024.06.25 CytoFLEX_Acquisition LogCOMET B.spiz
body:
Purpose:

  • Determine proportionality of (1) scatter count and (2) Hoechst and CellBriteFix640 count on Joy's B. spiz samples

 

Sample starting material(s): 

From 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
TSA B. spizizinii Rep B  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

 

Reference flow plots,

  • From Ready for export - 2024.05.24 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Vybrant Test
  • Note these were with Consumable - CBF555 so the read out is Y585

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex *Needed to make new tube
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions
    1. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Trigger -H = 1e4, -W
      NUV450 25  
      R660 200  
      V450 200 *Just for interest
      B525 200 *Just for interest
      Y675 200 *Just for interest
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS: Dilute 5 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 45 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Made a fresh Consumable - CBF640 solution on 6/18, use one of those aliquots (Lot# 17C1115-1201116)
  6. Prepare comp controls
    1. Tube name PBS HWS CBF Cells (medium-high concentration, S3)
      Unst 495 0 0 5
      CompH 494 1 0 5
      CompC 494.5 0 0.5 5
      ProbeOnly 498.5 1 0.5 0
    2. Move to incubator for 30 min
      1. Start time - 10:14 am
      2. End time - 10:44 am
  7. Acquire controls using the same conditions
    1. Run Unst, CompC, CompH, PBS, ProbeOnly
  8. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (18 samples +1)*987 uL buffer = 18.753 mL PBS
    2. 3.8 uL CBF 
    3. 38 uL HWS
    4. At 10:43 am
  9. Aliquot 990 uL staining buffer into 18 prelabeled 1.6 mL tubes
  10. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add 10 uL cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  11. Incubate tubes
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
      1. Start time: 11:15 am
      2. End time: 11:45 am
    2. Samples stored at 4C until immediately before run time
  12. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer 500 uL cells to flow tube 
    3. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 30 uL/min
    4. Repeat if second observation called for
  13. Cleanup
    1. **Note: 30 min with fresh 10% Consumable - Bleach for all surfaces**
    2. Run 10 min bleach and rinse with 10 min water
    3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
    4. Shutdown
    5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
    6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

Observations:

  • Can additional channels be used to identify debris?
  • Hoechst signal here looks different than previous for the presumed vegetative cell population. Ran S16_Rextra to check if the flow rate was the issue, no. Likely veg cells are degrading/losing DNA integrity over time? Overall count seems on par with before
  • Noticeable doublet/multiplets in VSSC-W. Will need to adjust from events to counts, seems like mostly spore presumed population. Might get tagged as a separate cluster in FlowSOM to separately enumerate.

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex

      NUV450 25 -W
      R660 200  
      V450 200 *Just for interest
      Y675 200 *Just for interest
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS: Dilute 5 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 45 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Make a fresh Consumable - CBF640 solution: Add 20 uL Consumable - DMSO to lyophilized probe tube. Lot# 17C1115-1201116 of CBF

      Unst 495 0 0 5
      CompH 494 1 0 5
      CompC 494.5 0 0.5 5

    2. Move to incubator for 30 min

  8. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (18 samples +1)*987 uL buffer = 18.753 mL PBS
    2. 3.8 uL CBF 
      1. Last time I used 19 uL CBF and the solution was all blue, likely too high a concentration.
      2. Reduced for this experiment, hoping that only the "cells" will stain and not the spores
      3. Make three other aliquots of 5 uL/tube and store in freezer
    3. 38 uL HWS
  9. Aliquot staining buffer into 18 prelabeled 1.6 mL tubes

    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add 10 uL cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  11. Incubate tubes

  • Spores and cells are similarly brighter than background in R660

title: 2024.06.17 CytoFLEX_Troubleshooting
body:
Purpose:

  • Get cytoflex to work again

 

Protocol:

  1. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
  2. Troubleshooting
    1. Run prime 5x
    2. Signal possibly improved but isn't good
    3. Reinstalled the same sheath filter
    4. Run System startup
    5. Rerun sample
  3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  4. Shutdown
  5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

Observations:

  • Realized that the y-axis (scatter, fluorescence) was extremely zoomed in for the channels I was worried about and not zoomed in for the ones that seemed flat.
  • Zooming into all of them revealed that they all were moving a bit
  • Joy suggested looking at bead sample immediately after service visit
  • Looked at three bead dates and found similar oscillation after zooming in on all dates
    • 20231106 - CCQM prep
      • SSC-A, FSC-A, B525-A
    • 20230613 - LogCOMET beads
      • SSC-A, B525-A
    • 20220204 - URCP
      • SSC-A, B525-A
  • Conclusion: this isn't an issue or new, that's why the cytometer still passes QC. Whatever was happening with the NUV450 on Ready for export - 2024.05.30 CytoFLEX_Acquisition LogCOMET B.spiz was a real issue but seems gone now.

title: 2024.06.20 SamplePrep_Test BactoBox Conductivity
body:
Purpose:

  • During a previous experiment ( In prep - 2024.05.30 BactoBox Acquistino LogCOMET B.spiz) the BactoBox gave conductivity errors at 1:100 dilution
  • Prepare MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture dilutions starting from 1:9 PBS or 1x PBS to see if the diluent or BactoBox was the issue

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
TSA B. spizizinii Rep A 1-24 MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

 

2024.06.20

  1. Prepare Consumable - 1:9 PBS Dilution 

    1. Mix 5 mL PBS with 45 mL Consumable - SterileWater

    2. Filter through 0.22 um

  2. Also prepare Consumable - PBS_Gr03 by filtering

  3. Add 1 mL of each diluent to make a control tube (A - 1:9 PBS, B - PBS)

  4. For each of the two diluent solutions:

    1. Dilute spore stock solution from approximately 5e8 cell/mL to starting concentration of 2e8 cell/mL in diluent,

      Dilute 0.48 mL cells into 0.72 mL diluent

    2. Transfer 600 uL stock solution to two tubes - label "E/H" (~ 2e8)

    3. Dilute 50 uL cell stock into 450 uL diluent - label "D/G" (~ 2e7)

    4. Dilute 50 uL D/G into 450 uL diluent - label "C/F" (~ 2e6)

  5. Dispose of all biohazardous waste and clean up

 

Sample end material(s): 

Copy this final sample table to subsequent record(s)

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner(s)
All  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture  ·       Cells are B. spizizinii (ATCC 6633, BSL1). Preparation is from TSA agar plate culture, contains spores and heat-treated vegetative cells.

·       Spore clean-up for samples and surfaces is 30 min treatment with fresh 10% bleach

·       Store at 4C until ready to use

 Person - Alshae' Logan
A, B   PBS (B), diluted PBS (A)  
E, H   2 e8 cell/mL in PBS (H) or diluted PBS (E)  
D, G   2 e7 cell/mL in PBS (G) or diluted PBS (D)  
C, F   2 e6 cell/mL in PBS (F) or diluted PBS (C)  

 

Observations:

  1. Passed conductivity check at 1751 on 1:9 PBS made from 224 millipore water
  2. Then A gave conductivity error of above 2100 (C79)
  3. Make a new dilution of A into 1:9 PBS that wasn't recently filtered (C80), failed with "electrical signal too high"
  4. Try again with 1:9 PBS made from 227 water, filtered. Conductivity = 1759
  5. Rerunning conductivity check on the stock 1:9 PBS made from 227 water (that wasn't refiltered), 1924
  6. Repeating step 5 to see if repeatable, 1924
  7. Prepping tubes with 10 mL of the ~1920 conductive solution
  8. Running A diluted into the chosen PBS (C83), gives "Electrical Signal is too high". Removed flow cell and dried off (following error 1001 troubleshooting guide)
  9. C84, rerun of step 8 sample. Gives "Electrical too high" again
  10. Clean/disinfection three times
  11. C85, rerun of step 8 sample. Gave "conductivity too low" error
  12. Clean
  13. C86, try B diluted into chosen PBS. "Conductivity too high" error
  14. Clean
  15. C87, measure the chosen PBS directly. "Electrical signal too high" error
  16. Change the flow cell, cleaning
  17. Measure conductivity of chosen PBS, 1931. Same as before!
  18. Immediately hitting measure on the same tube, C88. IT WORKED
  19. Clean
  20. C89, sample C. IT WORKED. ~110000 total (*Didn't run A and B since they were just PBS controls)
  21. Clean
  22. C90, sample D. ~370000 total
  23. Clean
  24. C91, sample E. 3570000 total
  25. C92, sample F. 62000 total
  26. Clean. C93, sample G. 380000.
  27. Clean. C94, sample H. 3590000.
  28. Shutdown

title: 2024.06.06 CytoFLEX_Troubleshooting
body:
Purpose:

  • Get cytoflex to work again

 

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
      1. Somehow this still passes QC!
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Today the NUV450 signal was fine but B525, FSC, SSC all were sine waves
  4. Tried multiple runs:
    1. Checked sheath filter connections
    2. ran prime ~10 times
    3. ran lots of water
    4. ran deep clean
    5. changed sample pump tube
  5. Signal did not improve:

  6. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  7. Shutdown
  8. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  9. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

 

Observations:

title: 2024.06.03 FormaldehydeFixation
body:
Purpose:

  • Use formaldehyde to stop cell growth

 

Sample starting material(s): 

 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
M9 broth MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229 These are stored in original packaging in 224/A140 fridge labeled with Joy's name Person - Sandra Da Silva
TSB MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_TSBecoli72hr_PS4155 These are stored in original packaging in 224/A140 fridge labeled with Joy's name Person - Sandra Da Silva

 

Protocol:

 

Gather the reagents and supplies:

1.            Consumable - 37%FormaldehydeSolution
2.            0.1 µm filtered Consumable - PBS_10x
3.            Consumable - NucleaseFreeWater
4.            300 & 1000 µl filter-tip pipettes
5.            Instrument - Rocker_A140
6.            Instrument - Microcentrifuge_A140

 

Make the fixation buffer:

Note: To scale up the recipe below, multiple the volumes of individual reagents by the total volume in mL + 5% excess 


For a final volume of 1.0 mL, mix:
o    100 ul Consumable - 37%FormaldehydeSolution
o    100 uL Consumable - PBS_10x
o    0.750 mL Consumable - NucleaseFreeWater

This will give a final solution of 3.7% v/v formaldehyde in 1X PBS when mixed with 50 uL of cells

 

Fix the cells:

  1. Resuspend pellet in 1 ml PBS
  2. Centrifuge 5000 x g for 4 min
  3. For each cell sample to be fixed, reduce to 50 uL volume
    1. Remove 750 ul supernatant with 1000 ul pipette
    2. Remove 200 ul supernatant with 200 or 300 ul pipette
  4. Add 100 µL freshly prepared fixation buffer, pipette mix, add 850 µL fixation buffer
  5. Vortex
  6. Mix on a Instrument - Rocker_A140 at room temperature for 60 minutes
  7. Pellet the cells by centrifugation (4 minutes, 5000 × g) at RT Instrument - Microcentrifuge_A140
  8. Remove supernatant- 800 µL, then 2x 100 µL
  9. Wash the cells in 500 mL 1× PBS by doing the following
    1. Resuspend first in 100 µl 1X PBS, pipette mix,  then add 400 µl 1X PBS
    2. Centrifuge at 4500×g for 5 min
    3. Aspirate supernatant
    4. Repeat step for a second wash
  10. After step 7a-c has been done twice, add 100 µL PBS, pipette mix, then add 400 µL PBS, pipette mix
  11. Store in fridge

 

Sample end material(s):

title: LogCOMET CFU B. spizizinii 05/30/2024
body:
Purpose:

  • ?

Sample starting material(s): 

If samples were prepared in a previous experimental record, copy final sample table to this record

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
   2024.05.30 LogCOMET Full Protocol.docx  Protocol for dilutions and plating  
  2024.05.30 Reporting Spreadsheet.xlsx for raw data  
  Logcomet May 2024 for images.   
       
...      

 

Protocol

Day1 5/30/2024

  1. Obtain supplies
    1. 1X PBS used for dilutions (made using 10X PBS cat#46-013-CM lot: 00219006 from Corning
    2. 31 TBA plates 
  2. Prepare dilutions
    1. List dilution conditions : see protocol below or  2024.05.30 LogCOMET Full Protocol.docx
  3. Plate dilutions
  4. Store in incubator
    1. Temperature: 37C
    2. Humidity: N/A
    3. Atmosphere: Aerobic
    4. Start time: 1:30pm
  5. Dispose of biohazardous waste and clean up per SOP
  6. Protocol used is attached in 2.1 as well as below

Protocol use

  1. Obtain reporting spreadsheet 

  1. Obtain cell samples and store at 4C until ready 

  1. Record time 

  1. Prepare agar plates for use (warm or dry as needed) 

  1. Obtain two 96 well plates to follow the layout here: 2024.05.30 CFU PlateLayout.xlsx 

  1. Obtain new bottle of PBS 

  1. Add 180 uL PBS to all labeled wells 

  1. Prepare samples in the order noted on tubes (sample 1, then 2, etc), for each sample tube: 

  1. Remove from fridge 

  1. Record time 

  1. Vortex the cell stock 

  1. Add 20 uL to the prelabeled well (this makes a 10^-1 dilution) 

  1. If sample tube indicates two replicate observations (e.g. “S1 r2” tube will generate wells S1R1 and S1R2), plate the row onto two agar plates 

  1. Use a multi-pipetter set to 20 uL to serially dilute across the labeled wells for all samples (will generate 10^-2, -3, -4 etc. dilutions) 

  1. Create drip plates for all samples 

  1. Label the agar plate with sample number, replicate observation number 

  1. Pipette up and down in the wells containing 10^-4, -5, -6, -7, -8 dilutions 

  1. Pipette 10 uL from wells containing 10^-4, -5, -6, -7, -8 dilutions onto agar 

  1. Drip plate 

  1. Record time 

  1. Also prepare one plate using the diluent PBS as a negative control 

  1. Record time that samples are placed in incubator __________ 

  1. Record incubator conditions (Temp _37C_, Humidity _Need_, Atmosphere _Atmospheric_) 

  1. Dispose of all biohazardous waste and clean up 

  1. Culture plates overnight 

 

Day2 5/31/2024

  1. Obtain samples from incubator
    1. 10:45am and CFU was counted. Note: remove plates early because this organism grows fast.
  2. For each plate
    1. Record count: 2024.05.30 Reporting Spreadsheet.xlsx
    2. (Optional) Record image: images were taken after 4hours at Room temperature. So some colonies may be touching or bigger than when they were counted. Logcomet May 2024
  3. Dispose of biohazardous waste and clean up per SOP

title: 2024.05.29 CytoFLEX_VolumeCalibration
body:
Purpose:

  • Calibrate Instrument - CytoFLEX volume measurements

 

Protocol:

  1. Start up the instrument
  2. Replaced sheath filter, primed
  3. Deep clean (10:30 - 11:05 am), primed
  4. System startup wizard
  5. Prepare 1 mL Consumable - SterileWater in flow tube
  6. Record mass of tube "before" 
    1.  4.4602 g
  7. Run volume calibration wizard
  8. Record mass of tube "after"
    1. 4.2799 g
  9. Determine whether calibration has passed

Observations:

title: 2024.05.30 CytoFLEX_Acquisition LogCOMET B.spiz
body:
Purpose:

  • Determine proportionality of (1) scatter count and (2) Hoechst and CellBriteFix640 count on Joy's B. spiz samples

 

Sample starting material(s): 

From 2024.05.30 LogCOMET_SamplePrep

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
TSA B. spizizinii Rep B  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

 

Reference flow plots,

  • From Ready for export - 2024.05.24 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Vybrant Test
  • Note these were with Consumable - CBF555 so the read out is Y585

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions
    1. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Trigger -H = 1e5
      NUV450 25 -W
      R660 200  
      V450 200 *Just for interest
      Y675 200 *Just for interest
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare dye stocks
    1. HWS: Dilute 5 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 45 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Make a fresh Consumable - CBF640 solution: Add 20 uL Consumable - DMSO to lyophilized probe tube. (Note: whole tube likely consumed by this experiment)
  6. Prepare comp controls
    1. Tube name PBS HWS CBF Cells (lowest concentration)
      CompH 494 1 0 5
      CompC 494.5 0 0.5 5
      ProbeOnly 498.5 1 0.5 0
    2. Move to incubator for 30 min
      1. Start time
      2. End time
  7. Acquire controls using the same conditions
    1. Run CompC, CompH, PBS, ProbeOnly
  8. Prepare staining buffer
    1. (18 samples +1)*987 uL buffer = 18.753 mL PBS
    2. 19 uL CBF 
    3. 38 uL HWS
  9. Aliquot staining buffer into 18 prelabeled 1.6 mL tubes
  10. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add 10 uL cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  11. Incubate tubes
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
      1. Start time: 
      2. End time:
    2. Move to 4 C until run time
  12. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer 500 uL cells to flow tube 
    3. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    4. Repeat if second observation called for
  13. FAILURE of INSTRUMENT:
    1. The NUV450 signal kept dropping to zero
    2. Restarting the instrument would briefly fix it
    3. Tried priming multiple times, running daily clean
    4. Eventually gave up and shutdown the instrument
  14. Cleanup
    1. **Note: 30 min with fresh 10% Consumable - Bleach for all surfaces**
    2. Run 10 min bleach and rinse with 10 min water
    3. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
    4. Shutdown
    5. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
    6. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas
    7. Samples were stored at 4C to try again when system is working

 

Observations:

  • Concentration of Consumable - CBF640 is likely too high, the supernatant was blue after staining

TSA B. spizizinii Rep B 1-24 MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared by Jen on 1/24/2024 In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

 

2024.05.29

Preparation:

  1. Prepare the Instrument - CytoFLEX
    1. Install new sheath filter
    2. Run deep clean
    3. Run volume calibration
  2. Label 18 10 mL orange cap tubes with 1:18 
    1. Stock solutions will be prepared in these 
    2. Stock will be aliquoted to samples for BactoBox, CFU, Coulter, Flow
  3. Label4 sets of 18 microcentrifuge tubes (1.6 mL volume) with 1:18  
    1. Label each tube to indicate 1 or 2 replicate observations 
  4. Prelabel 22 1.6mL Eppendorf tubes for Flow 
  5. Prelabel 22 cytometer tubes for Flow 
  6. Prelabel 18 Acuvettes for Coulter 
  7. Prepare 31 square plates of appropriate agar Consumable - TSA (Person - Monique Hunter)

  

2024.05.30

Preparing Dilutions:

  1. Filter PBS
  2. Dilute spore stock solution from approximately 5e8 cell/mL (could be previously counted with flow) to starting concentration of 2e8 cell/mL in PBS
    1. Dilute 2.4 mL cells into 3.6 mL PBS
    2. Record time - 7:48
  3. See GUI for generating dilutions
  4. For each tube
    1. Pipette the indicated media volume
    2. Invert the tightly closed cell stock x2 to mix
    3. Pipetted the indicated cell volume
    4. Record time
  5. Transfer appropriate amount from the stock dilution samples to an eppendorf each for BactoBox, CFU, Coulter, Flow
    1. Instrument Volume per sample tube (uL)
      BactoBox 400
      CFU 100
      Coulter 250
      Flow 100
  1. Give to each participant
    1. Store at 4C until transferred to participant
    2. Record time
  2. Dispose of all biohazardous waste and clean up

 

Sample end material(s): 

Copy this final sample table to subsequent record(s)

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner(s)
1:18  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture  

·       Cells are B. spizizinii (ATCC 6633, BSL1). Preparation is from TSA agar plate culture, contains spores and heat-treated vegetative cells.

·       Spore clean-up for samples and surfaces is 30 min treatment with fresh 10% bleach

·       KP will hand each participant 18 tubes (1.6 mL eppendorfs for BactoBox, 0.6 mL eppendorfs for everyone else) containing cell samples

·       Each tube is labeled “S#”. This corresponds to the sample number, there are 1 - 18

·       Each tube is also labeled “r1” or “r2”. This tells you the number of replicate observations that will be generated, either 1 or 2

·       Store at 4C until ready to use

  Person - Alshae' Logan, Person - Joy Dunkers, Person - Monique Hunter, Person - Kirsten Parratt

title: 2024.05.21 BactoBox_Acquisition B.spiz
body:
Purpose:

  • Assay Person - Joy Dunkers's MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture samples from previous culture In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol
  • Extract *.brd files from BactoBox Access to BactoBox Explorer to investigate raw data

 

Sample starting material(s): 

If samples were prepared in a previous experimental record, copy final sample table to this record

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
B. spiz Heat Rep A MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Grown overnight in broth overnight, heat treated Person - Joy Dunkers
B. spiz TSA rep A MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Grown on TSA for 14 days, heat treated Person - Joy Dunkers
B. spiz SA rep A MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Grown on SA for 14 days, heat treated Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

 

  1. Run system startup

      B98 TSA 1:10000  
      B99 SA 1:10000  
  6. Shutdown per SOP
  7. Clean up and dispose of waste per SOP
  8. Extract files from BactoBox to lab computer

title: 2024.05.24 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Vybrant Test
body:
Purpose:

  • Compare results from Consumable - Hoechst and Consumable - VDG_2836713 (VybrantDyeCycle Green)

 

Sample starting material(s): 

If samples were prepared in a previous experimental record, copy final sample table to this record

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
B. spiz TSA 1/24/24 JD MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared here In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers
B. spiz SA 1/24/24 JD MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Prepared here In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol Person - Joy Dunkers
Ecoli MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229 From fridge Person - Sandra Da Silva

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Will be a total of 7 samples
    1. With Hoechst: TSA, SA, Ecoli
    2. With VDG: TSA, SA, Ecoli
    3. With Hoechst and Consumable - CBF555: TSA
  4. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Dilute 2 uL Consumable - Hoechst into 18 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    2. Aliquot 990 uL of PBS into 5 different tubes
    3. Add 2 uL Consumable - VDG_2836713 to three tubes each
    4. Add 2 uL diluted Hoechst to three tubes each
    5. Add 2 uL Consumable - CBF555 to one tube of TSA/Hoechst
  5. Reconstituted a tube of ecoli ( MicrobialMaterial - Microbiologics_M9Ecoli72h_PS4229) in 10 mL PBS
    1. Diluted 100 uL of cell stock into 990 uL PBS
    2. Measured on CytoFLEX for 3 min, result ~2000 events in scatter gate per uL
    3. 2000 cell/uL*(1090/100 dilution)*1000 uL/mL = 2e7 cell/mL
    4. Means around 2e8 cell/pellet
    5. Stored in the fridge after use
  6. What are the approximate concentrations of the cell samples?
    1. For the B. spiz, around 5e8 spore/mL (from Ready for export - 2024.02.01 B. spizizenii CytoFLEX_Acquisition)
    2. For the Ecoli, about 2e7 cell/mL
  7. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock
    2. Add 10 uL B.spiz samples and 100 uL ecoli to staining buffer (Targeting about 1 - 5 e6 cell/mL)
    3. Vortex
  8. Incubate tubes
    1. 37C, 120 rpm
    2. Tube Name Start Time End Time
      TSA_H, SA_H, Ec_H, TSA_HCBF 12:02 12:42
      TSA_V, SA_V, Ec_V 12:55 1:25
  9. Prepare flow tubes, transfer 200 uL/sample
  10. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer cells to flow tube 
    3. Run on cytometer for (acquisition conditions)  
    4. Channel Gain Other
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 Width, Threshold 6000
      NUV450 25  
      B525 100  
      B610, B690, Y585, Y610 200  
  11. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
  12. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  13. Shutdown
  14. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  15. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas *30 min bleach*

 

 

Observations:

  • Vybrant concentration may be too high, solution very pink
  • Vybrant and Hoechst have differences, larger for E.coli than TSA/SA samples
  • Vybrant seems to change FSC slightly, again possibly because too high

title: 2024.05.09 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Prep for LogCOMET2 B.spiz
body:
Purpose:

  • *Continued work from 2024.05.07 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Prep for LogCOMET2 B.spiz
  • Test various fluorescent probes on MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture
  • Interested in how probe:cell concentration impacts results, how spores can be separated from non-spores (which are either veg cells or empty spores? Check with Joy on theories)

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details
TSA-A, B, C  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture

Sample that was cultured on Consumable - TSA (from a repeat culture of In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol)

 

General ideas:

  • Potential probes:
    • CellVue405 or PKH26: Lipids
    • CTGreen: Thiols.
      • I tried this previously with 2 uL probe in 5 mL PBS, then 500 uL staining with 5 uL cells at 2e7 cell/mL.
      • Staining occurred but spore was on par with non-spore, try higher probe concentration
    • CBF555: Amines
    • MitoView633

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Checked PBS, no leftover events from previous experiment
    3. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    4. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Using cell samples prepared on previous day
    1. Label Estimated concentration (cell/mL)
      A 1.75e6
      B 8.75e5
      C 1.75e5
  4. Divide into 4x aliquots of 198 uL cells for each condition
  5. Store remaining stocks in the fridge for future use
  6. Rerun the unstained controls at all gains
  7. Stock preparation conditions for probes:
    1. Probe Name Probe (uL) PBS (uL) Notes
      Consumable - MitoView633 2 18 Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell. Use R660
      Consumable - CBF555 4 4 Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell. Note the excitation options are 488 or 561, both are far off. Look for B610 and Y585
      Consumable - PKH26     Previously used 2 uL per e8 or e9 cells. Note: Cells need to be spun down, resuspended in 500 uL "Diluent C" from kit. Add PKH. Incubate. Spin down. Resuspend in PBS. Use Y585
      Consumable - CTGreen     Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell
  8. For each probe of interest, perform following steps
    1. File naming scheme
      • (Preparation SA vs TSA)_(Joy's BioRep identifier)_Gains_(My dilution/SampleRep identifier)_Stain_ObservationRep
    2. For each sample tube: 
      1. Vortex the cell stock 
      2. Add cells to staining buffer
      3. Vortex
    3. Incubate tubes at 35C, shaking 120 rpm
      1. Samples In Time Out Time Notes
        MitoView 12:25 12:41  
        CBF 1:29 1:46  
        CTGreen 1:09 1:23 This gave a massive, non-fluorescent signal. Something is wrong with this probe stock. Try CTR that I've used before instead
        CTRed 2:12 2:45 Run test aliquot of probe in PBS before using. Worked as expected. Note this is a Y585, Y610 probe. This turns out to be too high a concentration, there's significant background
        PKH 3:00 3:12 Spun down at 10k xg for 2 min. Only resuspended in 200 uL Diluent C. Left at room temp for incubation bc flammable. After removing probe solution, rinse 1x in PBS, resuspend to read
    4. Transfer sample to flow tube
    5. For each sample tube:
      1. Vortex sample 
      2. Transfer cells to flow tube 
      3. Run on cytometer for 2 min at 10 uL/min  
    6. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
  9. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  10. Shutdown
  11. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  12. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas, 30 min 10% bleach
  13. PKH26 waste to a separate container in the fume hood, other probes to shared waste in fume hood
  14. Transfer data to onedrive

 

Observations/Notes:

  • Samples within each probe set were run A, B, C with all three gain levels of A run before moving to B, etc. This means that samples with lower cell concentration are exposed to probe for longer periods
  • Only read one CTR from each concentration due to background
  • No cells remaining in PKH samples. Not surprising given the very low starting concentrations and the two rinses. Tried running on higher speeds to see anything
