title: 2024.05.07 CytoFLEX_Acquisition Prep for LogCOMET2 B.spiz
body:
Purpose:

  • Test various fluorescent probes on MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture
  • Interested in how probe:cell concentration impacts results, how spores can be separated from non-spores (which are either veg cells or empty spores? Check with Joy on theories)

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details
TSA-A, B, C  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture

Sample that was cultured on Consumable - TSA (from a repeat culture of In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol)
SA-A-1  MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture

Sample that was cultured on sporulation agar Consumable - Difco Amended Sporulation Agar (ANA) Recipe (from a repeat culture of In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol)

 

General ideas:

  • Potential probes:
    • CellVue405 : Lipids
    • DiBAC: Membrane potential
    • RSG: Activity, membrane permeability?
    • PI: Membrane permeability
    • CTR: Thiols.
      • I tried this previously with 2 uL probe in 5 mL PBS, then 500 uL staining with 5 uL cells at 2e7 cell/mL.
      • Staining occurred but spore was on par with non-spore, try higher probe concentration
    • CBF640: Amines
    • MitoView633
  • Start with single concentration of several probes at general concentration
    • Determine degrees of difference between spore/non-spore
    • Test changes in laser gain to see if large changes occur
  • Prep a range of cell concentrations
    • Try the same probe concentrations/laser gains on those
    • Preference for probes with large difference between cell populations

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Joy made a fresh culture of TSA samples, take a small portion to count before using
    1. Guess that this is at 5e8 cell/mL
    2. Dilute 2 uL into 998 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 (guess 1e6 cell/mL)
    3. Acquire and calculate
      1.  Count/20 uL *(1000/2)*1000
        Tube Approx Count in 20 uL Approx in 1 mL
        SA 2246 5e7
        TSA-A 3493 8.75e7
        TSA-B 2306 5e7
        TSA-C 4602 11.5e7
    4. Run enough to get a confident unstained control at different gains
  4. Prepare several concentrations of stock sample, at least 2 mL/concentration
    1. Label Cells (uL) PBS (mL) Estimated concentration (cell/mL)
      A 100 stock 4.9 1.75e6
      B 50 stock 4.95 8.75e5
      C 500 Hi dilution 4.5 1.75e5
  5. Divide into 2x aliquots of 198 uL cells for each condition
  6. Store remaining stocks in the fridge for future use
  7. Stock preparation conditions for probes:
    1. Probe Name Probe (uL) PBS (uL) Notes
      Consumable - DiBAC (2mM) 10 990 Dilution will be 20 uM, use 2 uL per 198 uL cells for 0.2 uM final
      Consumable - PI (1.5 mM) 4 16 Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell, gives 3 uM final
      Consumable - RSG 2 18 Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell, 
      Consumable - CellTrackerRed 2 18 Use 2 uL per 198 uL cell,
  8. For each probe of interest, perform following steps
    1. File naming scheme
      • (Preparation SA vs TSA)_(Joy's BioRep identifier)_Gains_(My dilution/SampleRep identifier)_Stain_ObservationRep
    2. For each sample tube: 
      1. Vortex the cell stock 
      2. Add cells to staining buffer
      3. Vortex
    3. Incubate tubes at 35C, shaking 120 rpm
      1. Samples In Time Out Time Notes
        DiBAC 2:08 2:23  
        PI 2:48 3:03  
        RSG 3:03 3:49  
    4. Transfer sample to flow tube
    5. For each sample tube:
      1. Vortex sample 
      2. Transfer cells to flow tube 
      3. Run on cytometer for 2 min at 10 uL/min  
    6. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
  9. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  10. Shutdown
  11. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  12. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas, 30 min 10% bleach
  13. Transfer data to onedrive

 

Observations:

  • Good dataset to test in LabCAS, want to extract laser gains
  • Samples within each probe set were run A, B, C with all three gain levels of A run before moving to B, etc. This means that samples with lower cell concentration are exposed to probe for longer periods

title: 2024.03.21 CovarisDNAExtraction CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Evaluate samples for Person - Monique Hunter's stability study

 

Sample starting material(s):

These come from In prep - 2024.03.08 FormaldehydeFixation for CovarisExtraction

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
Bc 4:6 Manufactured Material - NCTC_10743_Bc Formaldehyde fixed, 500 uL total Person - Joy Dunkers
Sa 4:6 Manufactured Material - NCTC_10788_Sa Formaldehyde fixed, 500 uL total Person - Joy Dunkers
Pa 4:6 Manufactured Material - NCTC_12924_Pa Formaldehyde fixed, 500 uL total Person - Joy Dunkers

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions from previous experiments
    1. Channel Gain Notes
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 4000-H threshold
      NUV450 50  
      V450 100  
  4. Prepare comp controls 
    1. Here, only unstained samples of each
    2. 3 tubes of 190 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 
    3. For each sample tube:
      1. Vortex sample 
      2. Transfer 10 uL cells to flow tube (concentration is unknown, likely between 1e6 and 1e8 cell/mL)
      3. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
  5. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 12k events in bead gate 
  6. Person - Joy Dunkers will be staining the cells
    1. Spins down, removes 400 uL supernatant
    2. Adds 5 uM Consumable - Hoechst to give a total of 4 uM after mixing
    3. Incubation per her protocol:
  7. Prepare staining buffer for my tube diluent to keep them in HWS
    1. Need: 2 uL HWS per 1 mL of ~1e7 cell/mL sample
    2. Expect 3 strains with 3x dilution reps and 3x tech reps, tech reps can come from repeated runs on the same tube
    3. So 9 mL of solution. But since these are already fixed I'll be diluting 15 uL cells into 135 uL buffer, ~200*9 = 1800 uL
    4. Add 2 uL Consumable - Hoechst to 18 uL of Consumable - PBS_Gr03 to make HWS
    5. Add 4 uL HWS to the 2 mL PBS
  8. Aliquot staining buffer into flow tubes
    1. 9 tubes with 135 uL/tube
  9. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add 15 uL cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  10. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    3. Repeat for the technical reps
  11. **After running the Sa_P1_A4_1:2 samples, there wasn't enough material for _3**
    1. Went and added 50 uL more of Hoechst buffer to each tube
  12. **The Pa samples were at higher concentrations, made a 10x dilution set of samples (still in HWS-containing PBS) following A4
    _St_1. Decided this made genome copies harder to distinguish, returned to higher concentration samples for A5 and A6, took an extra 4th read off the dilute sample**
  13. Sample Dilution (Buffer/Cells uL)
    Sa_A4_1:2 135/15
    Sa_A4_3, Sa_A5_1:3, Sa_A6_A1:3 185/15
    Bc all 185/15
    Pa_A4_1, Pa_A5_1:2, Pa_A6_1:2 185/15
    Pa_A4_2:3, Pa_A5_3, Pa_A6_3 450 buffer/ 50 (185/15)
    Pa_A6_4 90 PBS/ 10 (185/15)
  14. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
    1. Spores require 30 min of each
    2. BSL2 vegetative cells/fixed, 10 min each
  15. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  16. Shutdown
  17. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  18. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas
  19. Transfer data to onedrive

Data access instructions: 

File name(s)

Location

Details
CytoFLEX desktop\Isilon to ***REMOVED***

title: 2024.07.30 BSA + Bead Sample Prep
body:
Purpose:

  • Determine impact of Consumable - 7.5%BSASolution_Borrowed concentration on CountBrightBead counts, can protein passivation of the tube surface prevent Project - VanishingBeads
  • Note that I tried something very similar in March 2022 with TruCount beads (and homemade BSA). At the time, BSA did not make a large difference until higher concentrations and the addition of Consumable - Tween80 may have helped further. Results in that experiment were also all undercounts by ~5%  which suggests a volume calibration issue instead. 2% BSA + 1% Tween80 was the winner in that experiment

 

Protocol:

BSA dilutions:

  1. Obtained 1 mL of 7.5% BSA from Alex Tona (March 2024), expired but no visible aggregates
  2. Concentrations to select
    1. Papers suggest even 0.125 % might be sufficient to rescue bead count, original paper tested up to 2%
    2. We likely want to minimize the protein content due to overlap with flow signal
    3. Want to include zero, want two points showing leveling off
    4. Suggest: 0, 0.01 %, 0.10%, 0.25%, 0.50%
  3. Obtain 5 microcentrifuge tubes and label accordingly
  4. Turn on CytoFLEX
    1. System start up
    2. Volume calibration on slow
    3. Daily QC
    4. Run bleach, then water
  5. Prepare dilutions of BSA solution
    1. Tube BSA (uL) PBS (uL)
      A 133.3, stock 1866.7
      B 500, A 500
      C 200, A 800
      D 20, A 980
      E 0 1000
  6. Pipette 500 uL into flow tubes (NOTE: polystyrene), two per condition
    1. Try to minimize time that solutions sit in microcentrifuge tubes
  7. Obtain Consumable - CBPBeads_2707082 
  8. For each sample, starting from E and working to A
    1. Vortex CBP for 30 sec
    2. Add 50 uL directly to flow tube and pipette to mix
    3. Acquire tube for 2 min at 30 uL/min
    4. Vortex tube such that fluid goes all the way up the tube
    5. Take a second observation
  9. Read the second set of sample replicates after another hour of letting them sit. For this second set, tried to vortex less aggressively
  10. Run the QC beads to confirm their location in the plots
  11. Prepare a 1:50 dilution (20 uL beads in 980 uL diluent) of new "Duke Concentration standard beads" (normally used for coulter) into PBS
    1.  Consumable - DukeBeads_1um_280464  Target is 1e9 bead/mL in stock solution 
      1. Duke_1_2 corresponds to a 10X dilution of Duke_1_1 which was made with the listed dilutions
    2.  Consumable - DukeBeads_2um_280468  Target is 5e8 bead/mL in stock solution.
      1. Made the same dilution
  12. What happens if you add Consumable - Hoechst to a sample with BSA?
    1. Make 1:10 Hochest working stock
    2. Add 1 uL each to A1, C1, E1
    3. Put in 37C 120 rpm incubator
      1. 3 pm - 3:20 pm
    4. Run "Letter_1_H"
  13. Daily Clean
  14. Shutdown CytoFLEX
  15. Store bead samples (will be interesting to rerun and see whether numbers can be recovered on subsequent experiments)

 

Observations/Questions/Follow up:

  • Volume calibration was at 99.1% of target
  • All readings are low (~5k instead of 6k)
  • Replicate observations can be variable
  • There are two noticeable bead populations
    • The lower frequency population overlaps with the QC bead
    • The lower frequency population doesn't scale correctly in all fluorescent channels as a doublet would
    • But the counts in this subpopulation are very high, much higher than the PBS rinse after running QC...
  • Second set of samples has much lower unknown subpopulation
  • Increases in [BSA] are very noticeable in scatter even at these low values
  • This is a nice paper for stool flow characterization but doesn't mention count: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0091679X24000542?via%3Dihub#s0155 
  • Duke beads (run at higher concentration, gave noticeable doublets and maybe triplets)

 

Analysis Plans:

  • Count per sample, as a function of [BSA] or sample replicate number
  • Variability in counts
  • What are the abort rates per file?
  • Amount of BSA scatter in approximate cell gating region per concentration
  • Does amount of BSA scatter change over time? (ie Is it carrying over?)

 

Analysis Results:

  • Used CytExpert to estimate the concentration of Duke1um and 2 um
    • 1um: 96252 + 1132 + 886 from singlet/doublet/triplet in 60 uL, diluted 10*50 --> 8.43e8 bead/mL
    • 2 um: 56095 + 532 from singlet/doublet in 60 uL, diluted 10*50 --> 4.76e8 bead/mL

title: 2024.03.08 Wastewater Spike-ins CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Practice for Person - Alshae' Logan's wastewater spikein aliquots stability study 
  • This experiment will use only Consumable - Hoechst probe, future work could add a red cell body stain to improve separation of E.coli and B. sub in the mixture (if B525 vs V525 or NUV525 is insufficient)

 

Sample starting material(s): 

  • These will be provided by Person - Alshae' Logan with labeling ~10 am
  • Ecoli is MicrobialMaterial - 91802_GFP_Ecoli
  • Bsubtilis is MicrobialMaterial - 1A1135_YFP_Bsubtilis
  • Samples will be 300 uL of ~ 2e8 cell/mL
  • I will take 10 uL (~2e6 cell) and dilute directly into probe solution for incubation

 

Reference flow plots:

  • Previously Person - Joy Dunkers and I looked at these same strains for Ishi (Keenum)
  • Fresh B.sub were partially fluorescent (no added stains)
  • Fixed samples were not

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies, label tubes
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set the acquisition conditions based on previous experiments
    1. Channel Gain Notes
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 4000 - H threshold
      NUV450 50  
      NUV525 65  
      V525 26  
      V450 40  
      B525 200  
      B610 200  
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare comp controls 
    1. Can't really have a comp control for these materials, just an unstained sample of each
    2. Four tubes of 1 mL PBS, add 10 uL of each of the two strains X two preparations
  6. Acquire the comp controls
    1. Vortex each sample
    2. Add 100 uL sample to 300 uL PBS in flow tube
    3. Acquire for 3 min at 10 uL/min
  7. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Need 1 mL/sample for 12 samples
    2. Normally dilute Consumable - Hoechst 1:10 (to make HWS) then use 2 uL of HWS per 1 mL
    3. So 13 mL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 with 2.6 uL Consumable - Hoechst 
  8. Aliquot staining buffer to all 12 tubes
  9. Start with the live cells and work one material at a time
    1. For each sample tube: 
      1. Vortex the cell stock 
      2. Add 10 uLcells to staining buffer
      3. Vortex
    2. Incubate tubes
      1. 37C, 120 rpm, 15 min
    3. Material Start time End time
      E.coli Ctrl, B. sub Ctrl, EB Ctrl 1:30 2:05
      E.coli EtOH, B. sub EtOH, EB EtOH 2:25 3:00
  10. Prepare flow tubes, add diluent if needed (suggest 300 uL PBS)
    1. Changed the dilutions based on unstained counts, both Bs_Ct and Ec_Et were about 4x lower so those did not have any dilution into the tube
  11. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer 100 uL cells to flow tube 
    3. Acquire for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    4. Ran an extra tube of EB_EtOH_BR1 (called 1a) which did not have any dilution to tube and used NUV450-Width for curiosity
  12. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
    1. These are all vegetative cells, 5 min per cleaning on high speed
  13. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  14. Shutdown
  15. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  16. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas
    1. NOTE: All the EtOH samples are still in ethanol, this means they cannot be part of the bleach treated waste. Moved to container in fume hood
  17. Transfer data to onedrive Pull data from ***REMOVED***

Data access instructions: 

File name(s)

Location

Details
All ***REMOVED***   Under wastewater project

title: 2024.03.11 CovarisDNAExtraction CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Evaluate samples for Person - Monique Hunter's stability study

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Label

Database ID

Details

Owner
Bc MicrobialMaterial - NCTC_10743_Bc Prepared Experiment - 2024.02.23 CovarisDNAExtraction - Cell Culture Person - Monique Hunter
Sa MicrobialMaterial - NCTC_10788_Sa Prepared Experiment - 2024.02.23 CovarisDNAExtraction - Cell Culture Person - Monique Hunter
Pa MicrobialMaterial - NCTC_12924_Pa Prepared Experiment - 2024.02.23 CovarisDNAExtraction - Cell Culture Person - Monique Hunter
Bs MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture Spore material and vegetative material Person - Joy Dunkers
  • Monique will provide no bio reps, three different strains with one high level aliquot each
  • All in PBS at ~1e9 cell/mL with 500 uL total. Monique will take off 50 uL aliquots, we will be handed sub-aliquot replicates and take tech reps

Reference flow plots:

  • I've previously looked at Joy's spores: Experiment - 2024.02.01 B. spizizenii CytoFLEX_Acquisition
  • Sandra previously (2023.06.16) looked at fresh cultures of these materials

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex, blue laser repeatedly failed QC
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Set acquisition conditions from previous experiments
    1. Channel Gain Notes
      FSC 1000  
      SSC 20  
      VSSC 1 4000-H threshold
      NUV450 50  
      V450 100  
           
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare comp controls 
    1. Here, only unstained samples of each
    2. 3 tubes of 900 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 + 100 uL cells (target 1e7 cell/mL) from sub-aliquot 1
    3. Prep 3 flow tubes with 380 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03
    4. For each sample tube:
      1. Vortex sample 
      2. Transfer 20 uL cells to flow tube (target 5e5 cell/mL)
      3. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
      4. Repeat for the technical reps
  6. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Need: 2 uL HWS per 1 mL of ~1e7 cell/mL sample
    2. Expect 3 strains with 3x dilution reps and 3x tech reps, tech reps can come from repeated runs on the same tube
    3. So 9 mL of solution
    4. Add 1.8 uL Consumable - Hoechst to 9 mL of Consumable - PBS_Gr03
  7. Aliquot staining buffer
    1. 9 tubes with 900 uL/tube
  8. For each sample tube: 
    1. Vortex the cell stock 
    2. Add cells to staining buffer
    3. Vortex
  9. Incubate tubes
    1. 37C, 40 min, 120 rpm
    2. Species Start time End time
      Sa 2:57 3:37
      Bc 12:13 12:55
      Pa 1:55 2:35
  10. Prepare flow tubes, add 350 uL PBS to each
  11. For each sample tube:
    1. Vortex sample 
    2. Transfer 50 uL cells to flow tube 
    3. Run on cytometer for 3 min at 10 uL/min
    4. Repeat for the technical reps
  12. **Note: Sa looks great as is, Bc doesn't separate in FSC, Pa doesn't separate in FSC
  13. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
    1. Spores require 30 min of each
    2. BSL2 vegetative cells, 10 min each
  14. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  15. Shutdown
  16. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  17. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas

 

Example plots:

title: Coulter_Acquisition_Bspiziz_1Feb24
body:
Purpose:

  • To quantify total cell count for B. spizizenii MicrobialMaterial - ATCC_6633_Subculture grown on TSA  Consumable - TSA, SA Consumable - Bspiz_SA and on TSA overnight and then processed with heat, lysozyme and SDS from cultures grown In prep - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol. These values will be compared to flow cytometry.

Protocol:

 

  1. Run system startup
  2. Obtain buffer Consumable - BaxterSaline
  3. Prepare 3 rinse Accuvettes
  4. Prep sample Accuvettes. Weigh out 9.987 g saline.
  5. Run system QC with size calibration beads
    1. Added 7 drops of size calibration in 10 ml saline. Consumable - SizeQCBeads_Coulter_20um_Aperature
    2. Run size calibration according to instructions in SOP
    3. Record previous kd from logbook here: -31.346.
    4. Record current kd here: -31.346. 
    5. Record current kd in logbook as well
  6. Run system QC with concentration calibration beads Reagent - Conc.QCBead_Coulter
    1. Run concentration calibration using Duke standard 2.0 um beads that are 5 x 108 beads/ml. This is done as a regular run and compared to concentration on bottle label.
      Duke Standard NIST traceable microspheres cat no: 4K-02, Lot no: 214309, exp: 1/21.
    2. Added 10 µl to 9.987 g saline. Use rinse cuvette in between runs.
    3. Record standard conc. here: 5 x 108 beads/ml.
    4. Record conc. measured from run here (used Multisizer software):
      1. Concentration bead filename Integration region Concentration x 108 beads/ml
        Duke_beads_01.#m4 1.766->3.409 4.435
        Duke_beads_02.#m4 " 4.987
        Duke_beads_03.#m4 " 4.158
        Duke_beads_04.#m4 " 4.826
        Duke_beads_05.#m4 " 4.929
  7. Remove sample, dip aperture tube in rinse Accuvette
  8. Dilute 10 uL B. spizizenii cells  9.987 g (10 mL) buffer 
  9. Acquire data, using rinse Accuvette in between
  10. Shutdown per SOP
  11. Clean up and dispose of waste per SOP. Used bleach. 

    All data is in the Coulter computer folder: Desktop->Coulter data-> Joy->1feb2024

title: 2024.02.01 B. spizizenii CytoFLEX_Acquisition
body:
Purpose:

  • Analyze Manufactured Material - ATCC_6633_Subculture samples for Person - Joy Dunkers using flow cytometry

 

Sample starting material(s): 

Here is the sample generation protocol: Experiment - B. spizizenii sporulation protocol. All of these have been heat treated (maybe not vegetative?). Expecting to see a difference in spore percentage

Label

Database ID
TSA1:3  Manufactured Material - ATCC_6633_Subculture cultured on TSA
SA1:3 Manufactured Material - ATCC_6633_Subculture cultured on SA (sporulation agar)
V1 Manufactured Material - ATCC_6633_Subculture vegetative
All Estimate at 5e9 cell/mL

 

Images from last time:

 

Protocol:

  1. Gather supplies
    1. Probes
    2. Tubes
  2. Turn on cytoflex
    1. Run system start up
    2. Run QC Reagent - QCBeads_Cytoflex
    3. Run Reagent - PBS_Gr03 to check event rate is low (<50 eps)
  3. Acquisition conditions from previous work (below)
  4. Run Reagent - RainbowBeads sample to 30k events in bead gate 
  5. Prepare staining buffer
    1. Filter 13 mL PBS
    2. 5 mL PBS + 1 uL Consumable - Hoechst + 2 uL Consumable - CellTrackerRed (new higher volume for CTR in this experiment)
  6. Aliquot staining buffer
    1. 0.495 mL to 8 tubes
    2. 0.495 mL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 for three unstained tubes
  7. Obtain cell samples from Joy, keep in fridge until use
  8. Repeat process for each sample type (e.g. TSA samples) so that time in probe is controlled for 
    1. For each sample tube: 
      1. Vortex the cell stock 
      2. Add 5 uL cells to staining buffer (estimate 5e7 cell/mL)
      3. Vortex
    2. Incubate tubes
      1. 37C, 120 rpm, ~15 min
      2. Start/end time Veg: 11:46 - 12:01 pm
      3. Start/end time TSA: 12:34 - 12:51 pm
      4. Start/end time SA: 1:28 - 1:44 pm
    3. Prepare flow tubes
      1. Add 160 uL Consumable - PBS_Gr03 per tube, 8 tubes
      2. *This was different than the original planned dilution, tried a 200:5 with Veg_Unst_A_1 and could tell it was too low
    4. For each sample tube:
      1. Vortex sample 
      2. Transfer 40 uL cells to flow tube with prepared PBS immediately before running
      3. Run on cytometer for 3 minutes at 10 uL/min
      4. Channel Gain Other
        FSC 1000  
        SSC 20  
        VSSC 1 4000 H, width
        B525 500  
        Y585 500  
        Y610 500  
        NUV450 50  
      5. Collect three replicates per sample, 21 total, > 1hr analysis
  9. Clean with bleach and rinse with water
  10. Run system shutdown Reagent - FlowClean
  11. Shutdown
  12. Empty cytoflex waste to Reagent - Bleach 
  13. Clean all biohazardous waste and workareas
    1. Per Joy, 30 min bleach for spores
  14. Transfer data to onedrive

 

****NOTE: Zhiyong and Ning troubleshooting the instrument on 2024.02.12. See paper lab notebook for full notes, Ning suggest in future cleaning be switched from bleach to long (~2hr) DeepClean.
